title: Beaumont Municipal Airport
text:
Beaumont Municipal Airport is seven miles west of downtown <a href="Beaumont%2C%20Texas">Beaumont</a>, in <a href="Jefferson%20County%2C%20Texas">Jefferson County, Texas</a>. The <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2017–2021 <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility.
Airlines at Beaumont operate from <a href="Jack%20Brooks%20Regional%20Airport">Jack Brooks Regional Airport</a> (BPT) south of the city.
Facilities.
The airport covers 276 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (112 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 32 feet (10 m). It has two <a href="runway">runway</a>s: 13/31 is 4,001 by 75 feet (1,220 x 23 m) <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a>; 16/34 is 2,050 by 75 feet (625 x 23 m) turf.
In the year ending July 30, 2011 the airport had 15,500 aircraft operations, average 42 per day: 97% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> and 3% military. In August 2017, 30 aircraft were based at the airport: 25 single-engine, 1 multi-engine, 1 jet and 3 <a href="helicopter">helicopter</a>.
History.
The airport opened in 1937; construction was a <a href="Works%20Project%20Administration">Works Project Administration</a> project. The airport was used <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> by the <a href="United%20States%20Army%20Air%20Corps">Army Air Corps</a> for antisubmarine patrols. Until around 1940 Eastern Air Lines flights between Houston and New York stopped at Beaumont, one a day each way, and the airport probably never saw airlines after that—it didn't get a paved runway until the 1960s.
Improvements.
A $230,000 building replaced the original terminal building in the late 1970s. Other improvements included paved runways, taxiway, parking apron and lighting costing $593,000.
Runway and taxiways were improved in 2009; partial financing was from a $2.9 million grant from the Texas Department of Transportation.
In 2014 facilities were completely renovated. Upcoming improvements include a 12,500 sq ft hangar, a 2,500 sq ft office building, removal of a two unit T-Hangar replaced by an eight unit T-Hangar.
